title: Modiano Poster Font. Probably Hand Drawn, But Maybe A Font. Gorgeous.
content:
Would be grateful if anyone can ID both the MODIANO under the red hand, and the other "Cartine e Tubetti per sigarette" font underneath.

Stylish, no?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [red hands with cigarette.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100727190130/http:/typophile.com/files/red%20hands%20with%20cigarette.jpg) | 489.43 KB |
author: ignatiusx

comments.content: Alas, I have no idea. My coworker found it in a random google search on smoking. Seems 20s or 30s.

You won't find a match as this was hand lettered. Have a look at [Mostra](http://web.archive.org/web/20100727190130/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/mark_simonson_studio/mostra/), [Bahnof](http://web.archive.org/web/20100727190130/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-10-bahnhof), [Anisette](http://web.archive.org/web/20100727190130/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/font_bureau/anisette/), and [Neutraface](http://web.archive.org/web/20100727190130/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/neutraface).
Or modify Futura or Gill Sans...
